name: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Cybersecurity in Information Technology

Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Cy: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Cybersecurity in Information Technology The Certificate of Undergraduate Study (CUGS) in Cybersecurity in Information Technology is designed to offer students the opportunity of a specialized study to provide students with experience in key courses of this discipline at the undergraduate level. This CUGS prepares students to sit for the following certification exams: CompTIA Security+ IT Fundamentals CompTIA A+ CYSA: CompTIA Cybersecurity Analyst+

notes: Required Courses: 12 s.h. Students seeking this CUGS are required to successfully complete (grade of D- or better) the four courses listed below:
Total Required Credits for the Program: 12 s.h. Fred Stinchcombe Advisor Robinson Hall 328I 856.256.4805 stinchcombe@rowan.edu
